1438257045476610053.text: The Tribal Healthcare Careers Act (H.R. 4316) would specifically provide dedicated funds to federally recognized tribes, tribal organizations, and tribal colleges and universities to administer their own Health Professional Opportunity Grant (HPOG) programs. (7/7)

1438256962001637385.text: The New Home Energy Efficiency Act (H.R. 5188) would extend the section 45L tax credit for the construction of energy efficient new homes, increase it from $2,000 to $2,500 for homes meeting modern energy efficiency standard, and expand the incentive for multifamily homes. (6/7)

1438256890086055939.text: The Home Energy Savings Act (H.R. 5187) would increase the tax credit under section 25C of the tax code from 10% to 30% and establish higher goals for energy efficient home upgrades by modernizing efficiency standards. (5/7)

1438256661353934856.text: The Home Energy Savings Act and New Home Energy Efficiency Act would increase incentives to make homes more efficient, help lower consumers’ energy bills, and reduce carbon emissions while simultaneously creating jobs. (4/7)

1438256477651750917.text: The Affordable EVs for Working Families Act (H.R. 4817) creates a tax credit for the purchase of preowned electric cars­­, expanding access to electric vehicles for low- and middle-income people, as well as accelerate our transition to clean, renewable transportation. (3/7)

1438256333166370819.text:
The Affordable Housing Equity Act (H.R. 5219) would provide a basis boost of up to 50% for residential units that house Extremely Low-Income (ELI) renters, effectively increasing the Low-Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC) program for eligible projects.

(2/7)
